Overall, I thought HL2 was a great purchase. I love the graphics, the sound and the story. My main complaint is that some parts of the game go on a little too long, which makes the game difficult to replay. Other than that, this game was perfect.

Definately worth the $10, as I have bought worse games for $20.

A piece of art. Really fun, lots of changing elements that give a variety of obstacles to overcome, and really cool action scenes. The only complaint I have is that there's never a break; you're always on the move doing stuff, which isn't really a complaint but you get the idea.

Half-Life 2 was ahead of its time and still feels fresh, exciting, and more memorable than most modern single-player first person shooters today. It pushed the boundaries of graphics and physics while telling a story in a unique manner, wrapped up with excellently-paced gameplay.
